thread.title: @SC_VARSITY HIGHLIGHTS OF THE DAY FOR OCT. 22
thread.title_full: @SC_VARSITY HIGHLIGHTS OF THE DAY FOR OCT. 22

title: @SC_VARSITY HIGHLIGHTS OF THE DAY FOR OCT. 22
text: Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 10:21 PM Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 10:21 PM » Social News Follow us on Twitter to get story updates, sports scores and highlights of the day! MVP Reaghan Tripp, Westport The senior midfielder notched two goals to power Westport to a 6-0 win over Holbrook Thursday and punch the Wildcats ticket to the postseason tournament. Tripp now has 16 goals on the season. QUOTABLE “We were more frustrated with the tie. It hurts more than losing. It’s a big letdown for us. After our big game against Martha’s Vineyard and winning the conference, this kind of hurt.”— Bishop Stang field hockey coach Eleanor Taylor after a 1-1 tie with Dartmouth on Thursday. TODAY'S GAMES West Bridgewater at Westport, 3:30 p.m. Dighton-Rehoboth at GNB Voc-Tech, 3:30 p.m. Fairhaven at Bourne, 4 p.m. FIELD HOCKEY Dighton-Rehoboth at Apponequet, 3:30 p.m. Fairhaven at Wareham, 3:30 p.m. Old Rochester at Case, 3:30 p.m. FOOTBALL Bishop Stang at Bishop Feehan, 7 p.m. Brockton at New Bedford, 7 p.m. Case at Fairhaven, 7:30 p.m. Dartmouth at Barnstable, 7 p.m. GNB Voc-Tech at Bourne, 7 p.m. Maynard at Apponequet, 7 p.m. Wareham at Dighton-Rehoboth, 7 p.m. GIRLS SOCCER Apponequet at Old Rochester, 3:30 p.m. Bourne at Fairhaven, 3:30 p.m. Westport at West Bridgewater, 3:30 p.m. GNB Voc-Tech at Dighton-Rehoboth, 4 p.m. VOLLEYBALL Westport at Bristol-Plymouth, 5 p.m. Southeastern at Old Colony, 5 p.m. Durfee at New Bedford, 5:30 p.m. Sacred Heart at Bishop Stang, 5:30 p.m. Apponequet at Old Rochester, 6 p.m. Bourne at Fairhaven, 6 p.m. GNB Voc-Tech at Dighton-Rehoboth, 6 p.m. RED SOX Good news for Farrell BOSTON — Red Sox manager John Farrell received news Thursday that his cancer is in remission, the team announced. Farrell completed chemotherapy in late September and had undergone scheduled post-treatment testing at Massachusetts General Hospital on Wednesday. Farrell was diagnosed with non-Hodgkin's Burkitt lymphoma on Aug. 10 and took a leave of absence. Team president Dave Dombrowski announced just before the end of the season that Farrell would return as manager next season, health permitting. Bench coach and longtime Farrell friend Torey Lovullo took over as interim manager for the rest of the reason and will return as bench coach next season, giving up the chance to interview for managerial jobs to provide insurance should Farrell not be back to 100 percent by next spring. — Brian MacPherson CORSAIRS Tennis makes LEC final Kristen Rose, a senior from North Dartmouth, won the deciding match at fourth singles to help lead the fourth-seeded UMass Dartmouth women's tennis team to a 5-4 victory at top-seeded Rhode Island College in the semifinals of the Little East Conference Tournament on Thursday. Rose notched a 6-4, 6-4 victory over Tressa Cannata and teamed up with sophomore Mollie McCaffrey for an 8-4 pro-set win at third doubles. Maggie LeBrun, a senior from Mattapoisett, rallied for a 2-6, 7-5, 6-1 win at third singles and the Corsairs also got singles victories from McCaffrey (6-2, 6-4 at number five) and sophomore Samantha Rollings (6-3, 6-1 at number six). UMD will play for the championship at second-seeded Bridgewater State (10-5) on Saturday. The Bears advanced with a 6-3 semifinal win over third-seeded Plymouth State. RIC wrapped up a 12-3 season. southcoasttoday.com
